01200_GPCrypto_mac
[GP]

Functions

 TestCase_GC00100_GPCRYPTO_HMAC_MD5 ()
 TestCase_GC00100_GPCRYPTO_HMAC_SHA1 ()

Detailed Description

Description:
: Test the TA cryptographic functions TEE_MACInit, TEE_MACUpdate, TEE_MACComputeFinal, TEE_MACCompareFinal

Function Documentation

TestCase_GC00100_GPCRYPTO_HMAC_MD5 (  )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
bcc622fdd7d358f68b4a3630b958ba4f
Pre Conditions:
none
Focus:
TEE_MACInit, TEE_MACComputeFinal
Description:
KAT tests for HMAC-MD5. Vectors are taken from RFC 2202
Test Steps:
Calls TEE_MACInit and TEE_MACComputeFinal. Result is returned from TA and checked in the NWD
Verification:
TEE_MACInit, TEE_MACComputeFinal
Post Conditions:
none
Manual Execution:
No
Trustonic Test Suite Testcase:
No
Final Device Testcase:
No
Extensive Testcase:
No
Basic Testcase:
Yes
Quick Testcase:
No
Minimum Product Version required for this testcase:
310A
Test ID:
GP.01200_GPCrypto_mac.GC00100_GPCRYPTO_HMAC_MD5

TestCase_GC00100_GPCRYPTO_HMAC_keysize_support (  )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
bcc622fdd7d358f68b4a3630b958ba4f
Pre Conditions:
none
Focus:
TEE_AllocateTransientObject, TEE_MACComputeFinal
Description:
Goal of the test is to check if all key sizes are supported by the implementation.
Test Steps:
TA starts from smallest key tries to initialize transient object with this key and compute HMAC. If OK, 8 bits are added to key size and the test starts again. Test fails if transient object can't be initialized with any of the key size. Result of the HMAC is not checked (as it's not a goal of the test).
Verification:
TEE_AllocateTransientObject
Post Conditions:
none
Manual Execution:
No
Trustonic Test Suite Testcase:
No
Final Device Testcase:
No
Extensive Testcase:
Yes
Basic Testcase:
Yes
Quick Testcase:
No
Minimum Product Version required for this testcase:
310A
Test ID:
GP.01200_GPCrypto_mac.GC00100_GPCRYPTO_HMAC_keysize_support
TestCase_GC00100_GPCRYPTO_HMAC_WrongOutputBufferSize (  )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
bcc622fdd7d358f68b4a3630b958ba4f
Pre Conditions:
none
Focus:
TEE_AllocateTransientObject, TEE_MACComputeFinal
Description:
Checks if TEE_MACComputeFinal returns error if too small size of the output buffer is provided
Test Steps:
3 Wrong sizes are tested in 3 steps
  • 0 size of output buffer
  • size between 0 and max-1
  • max-1 size
Verification:
TEE_AllocateTransientObject, TEE_MACComputeFinal
Post Conditions:
none
Manual Execution:
No
Trustonic Test Suite Testcase:
No
Final Device Testcase:
No
Extensive Testcase:
Yes
Basic Testcase:
Yes
Quick Testcase:
No
Minimum Product Version required for this testcase:
400A
Test ID:
GP.01200_GPCrypto_mac.GC00100_GPCRYPTO_HMAC_WrongOutputBufferSize
TestCase_GC00100_GPCRYPTO_HMAC_TEE_MACCompareFinal (  )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
bcc622fdd7d358f68b4a3630b958ba4f
Pre Conditions:
none
Focus:
TEE_AllocateTransientObject, TEE_MACCompareFinal
Description:
Checks TEE_MACCompareFinal.
Test Steps:
Test checks following cases * Nominal case - expected value corrsponds to provided message and a key * Expected has correct length but wrong data * Expected value is too short * Expected value is too long
Verification:
TEE_AllocateTransientObject
Post Conditions:
none
Manual Execution:
No

Yes
Basic Testcase:
Yes

GP.01200_GPCrypto_mac.GC00100_GPCRYPTO_HMAC_TEE_MACCompareFinal
TestCase_GC00100_GPCRYPTO_HMAC_TEE_MACUpdate (  )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
bcc622fdd7d358f68b4a3630b958ba4f
Pre Conditions:
none
Focus:
TEE_MACUpdate
Description:
Checks implementation correctness of TEE_MACUpdate
Test Steps:
Input data is splited into equal size chunks and processed by TEE_MACUpdate function. Then TEE_MACComputeFinal function is called to compute resulting HMAC. Result of an operations is checked in NWd against expected result.
Verification:
TEE_MACUpdate
Post Conditions:
none
Manual Execution:
No
Trustonic Test Suite Testcase:
No
Final Device Testcase:
No
Extensive Testcase:
Yes
Basic Testcase:
Yes
Quick Testcase:
No
Minimum Product Version required for this testcase:
310A
Test ID:
GP.01200_GPCrypto_mac.GC00100_GPCRYPTO_HMAC_TEE_MACUpdate
